timeline.timeline: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: We sent Nonno home while it was still light outside.
She made a tutorial for the Game of Life before she left though, and was whining about how she wanted to stay and play with us.
Anyway, things had settled down, so I figured it was a good time put a carrianode on Momo.
Giving her access to BMI would make info-sharing way smoother.
I'll use this to open a hole in your ear for an electrode. It's just like getting a piercing.
It might hurt a little, but you won't bleed or anything, so don't worry.
She lifted her hair, showing her ear and neck.
I put her ear into the device.
A piercing-like electrode slipped into her ear.
The early ones were a real pain to put on, though. It was a while before the process got this simple.
Now we just have to clip a carrianode onto it.
I'd ordered one that afternoon and it had already been delivered. It wasn't some luxury model, but it'd get the job done.
Clipping it onto the electrode only took a second.
There were people out there with a whole bunch of different carrianodes they wore as fashion accessories.
Her profile was taken care of too. Cross and I had gone to get her a forged one.
These days, profiles were linked to census data and stuff, so it was pretty hard to fake them.
That's why we went to a white hat purveyor company, where Momo could pay to get one made.
She'd also decided to use the name "Momo Aizaki."
It made sense, considering she had the Vatican after her.
I was kinda embarrassed that she was actually using that name I'd just thought up outta nowhere.
Wh-what are you looking at? If you got somethin' to say, just spit it out!
I was just thinking about how nice you are.
I gotta admit your handiwork had me worried, but you did a good job.
W-wipe that stupid grin off your face!
Aizaki, I set it up so you can contact us.
And you can see Yomi now, right?
Hello. Don't you dare try to seduce my Windy.
Thank you all very much. I'm sure this will help me find Kent Korihisa.
Momo still wanted to go it alone. Geez, talk about stubborn.
Hey, have you ever seen Cicada's face?
Yes. I saw a photo of him that was taken while he was at the Vatican.
WHOA?! YOU BEIN' SERIOUS?! You saw Cicada's face? That's hella spicy! We could make a killer 4chan thread about that!
But I don't have that photo with me.
Why don't you draw him from memory, then?
Good idea. You can use the paint app.
We taught her how to use the app and she spent about half an hour drawing.
I think I captured his features quite well!
All right. Well, putting that aside...
Let's start looking into Cicada. All of us.
If we all come together on this, we're bound to find some trace of him.
What the hell is going on?
Two hours had passed since we started.
There was absolutely nothing on the internet about Cicada 3301 or Kent Korihisa.
Obviously, we couldn't find a thing about his time at the Vatican either.
This doesn't make sense. We should be able to find at least a scrap of info. It's like...
There's nothing about the Ochanomizu thing, either.
Cicada put up the first of his quests in May last year, and it was supposedly posted from somewhere in Ochanomizu.
That info was discovered independently by someone Momo knew, and it wasn't available anywhere else.
That's why it wasn't too weird that there was nothing about it on the internet...
But Momo said she'd come all the way to Japan on that one lead.
That was actually the reason she went to the Ochanomizu Crater before we met.
We didn't know where Kent Korihisa was from exactly...
...but even when we looked at the entire country's records for people with that name born around 1990, we didn't get a single hit.
It was always possible that paper records of his birth were filed at some facility near his birthplace...
...but finding that would have taken ages.
Pollon, I talked with the info brokers I know. No dice.
Apparently, a bunch of others have asked them to look into Cicada's identity before.
That made sense. There were probably tons of people who wanted to make a name for themselves by unmasking Cicada.
But no matter how hard they tried, they found absolutely nothing, so they've all thrown in the towel.
There's not a single info broker out there who hasn't looked into Cicada. Not a single one who knows who he is, either.
At this point, people are actually saying that if you wanna know more about Cicada, you gotta go to 4chan's hacker board, /hack/.
Hackers the world over go there for a shot at completing his quests, so there'll be a heap of people on it who wanna know more about Cicada.
He posts his quests on a bunch of sites, but 4chan's the one with the most people.
How much does /hack/ know about Cicada, anyway?
They don't know zip. Not a single hacker there has ever met him.
It's like his whole existence is a mirage or something.
Maybe he was actually a fictional character to start with? The more I investigated the guy, the more plausible it seemed.
The /hack/ers don't even know his real name's Kent Korihisa.
His name alone is actually a real bombshell piece of info. Let's post it. They might help us out.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Is there any way we can prove it's real? I'm pretty sure they'll ask for a source.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: I don't have anything at hand...
That's gonna make it hard to convince them...
There was also the fact that the wrong kind of post could put the Vatican on our trail.
We're not sharing it. There's no way to gauge how risky it is for Momo.
Anyway, tell us about the quests, Wind. You know more about 'em than any of us.
Momo probably knew about them too, but I needed a refresher.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Wind had gathered all the information he could find about the quests. He was the best resource we had.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: I'm gonna have to look over all this info I got.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: As he said that, he started caressing his own arms. It looked like some weird dance.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: It's a <tips,32,rigmesh>. He's not dancing. That's just how he controls his BMI.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: You could execute the registered commands by touching it with your fingers. It was basically just an input device, like my keyboard.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: It wasn't like you could get the desired results by touching it however you wanted, though—the commands changed depending on how you touched it.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Wind's input motions were really exaggerated. That was probably 'cause he thought he looked cool and wanted to show off.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Normally, people calibrated these so they'd require only the bare minimum movement.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Cicada is a person who, without any prior notice, posts images or URLs in the main internet communities.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: You can get clues about the incidents Cicada causes by analyzing those posts.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: At that stage, almost nobody can actually guess what the incidents are gonna involve, though.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: People only notice the link between the clues and the incidents after the incidents actually happen.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: We'd participated in two of the past quests.
When they came in, hackers the world over desperately tried to analyze the resources Cicada provided.
The quests were so tough that even wizard-tier hackers were left scratching their heads, though.

scenes.label: *Hacker_Ranking

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

stoptimeline.stoptimeline: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

timeline.timeline: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: We tackled the quests without any preparations; of course we couldn't pitch in to the effort that much.
Hackers that contribute to quest analysis or do stuff that could help prevent the incidents get higher placements.
This stuff isn't managed by Cicada himself, though. The people on /hack/ did it themselves. Cicada's completely uninvolved.
They're into all these wild events, and some of them even gamble on them.
Cicada 3301 would cause the incidents he hinted at, whether they were analyzed or not.
Not a single hacker had been able to stop them, and people had died.
And then there were these weirdos, treating the whole thing like some party...
This is why I hate hackers...

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Don't group me in with them.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: I would've switched jobs the first chance I got.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Nobody's actually prevented an incident yet, but the hackers who help most during the analysis stage can still reach the top of the ranks.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Being up at the top got you attention from fellow hackers all over the world, as well as individuals and companies looking to hire white hats.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Knowing hackers, most of them were probably more interested in making a name for themselves than actually completing the quests.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: The Nakano Symphonies members are ranked, umm... Oh! Takaoka's in 9,487th! And Yumikawa's in 9,709th!

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: I guess Yumikawa's lower because he tends to act as Takaoka's support.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Well, it's not like I care where I am in the rankings! I'm not even a hacker, unlike you two.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: I don't remember putting my name there.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Anyone who gets even a little bit involved in the quest solving has their name put on there, whether they like it or not.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Wow... Well, whatever. The rankings didn't matter.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Why's Cicada doing all this, anyway?

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Huh? You took part in those quests without knowing any of that? That's actually so cool. In a weird way.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Cicada 3301's first post included a message from him, detailing his motives.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: This was posted on /hack/ some time after the Sad Morning. It was Cicada 3301's comeback post.
The text here, by the way, is the same as it was in 2010.
Does this mean that if we prevent an incident, Cicada might come to see us?
Maybe? Nobody has done that yet though, so who knows.
We'd looked into Cicada as thoroughly as possible and still found nothing. It was like the quests were the only lead we had left.
And Cicada himself was waiting at the end of them.

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

texts: Cicada just posted a new quest! /hack/ is going wild!
Talk about perfect timing. Looks like Cicada knows about us.
It's gotta be a coincidence. There's no way we're the first hackers to conduct an investigation into him.
Man... You never lose your cool, huh?
He didn't have to spell it out. I knew it was a coincidence.
Can you bring it up for us?
Wait wait wait... There ya go.
The gall to say that when he was planning some kinda disaster. I really didn't like this guy.
If we used some specific method to analyze this image, we could find a hint leading to the incident Cicada was plotting...
Momo was staring at the image with an intense expression.
Nakano Symphonies is gonna do everything in its power to complete this quest.
You should know by now I'm not the kinda guy who gives up after a couple rejections.
It's not like this quest will be a cakewalk, y'know.
Yeah, we didn't get anywhere the last two times. But I'm not the same person I was back then.
If you're planning to use the you-know-what, I'm gonna go ahead and remind you to be careful.
Momo gave me a little nod. She knew about the Saving and Loading too.
I won't rely on it too much.
It was still way too mysterious and suspicious.
But we didn't have the skill to get to Cicada 3301 using normal methods.
If no one's ever prevented one of these quest incidents...
And then I'd drag Cicada 3301 out into the open. He could count on that.
Ooh, our boy is acting all cool in front of his gf! Don't worry, I totally get ya!
Wind still believed that Momo was my gf and that we were eloping.
But it would've been a real pain to explain the whole story.
You're not gonna tell him the truth?
I-I'll do it some other time.
And I'm not just acting cool here!
I mean every word I say!
Cicada and all the other hackers everywhere are gonna find out what I'm all about!

timelines.label: 追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ
追加_腕c切り替えばたばたループ

scenes.label: *polonsave7
texts: We'd tried all kinds of stuff ourselves, but we were pretty powerless compared to the collective knowledge of 4chan.
First, Cicada had posted the image of a flower.
It had been treated using <tips,33,steganography>, and an analysis revealed some text in <tips,34,Esperanto>.
The text was a riddle, and solving it produced another riddle, and so on.
We'd ultimately arrived at a certain URL.
That's where we found this image, which contained some letters and numbers whose color made them stand out.
It was the number of a passenger plane.
It was a regular plane that went to and from Haneda several times a day.
After we got the hint, we monitored JA1037E carefully. Nothing seemed amiss, though.
Night fell as we watched, and the airport closed before long.
JA1037E stopped flying for the day and was currently parked at the Ninoy Aquino airport in the Philippines.
The hackers on 4chan had concluded that nothing would happen that night.
With that in mind, we decided to call it a day and go home.
I couldn't leave Momo at Symphony all by herself, so I took her to my place.
Symphony was safe, sure, but there was no bed there, so it wasn't an ideal place for anyone to stay for days at a time.
It was really late, but Momo wasn't sleeping. She was staring at her BMI, intently following the quest progress.
Why don't ya get some rest?
I'm fine. Feel free to sleep. You needn't wait up for me.
Take care not to overdo it.
I left the room to get something to drink.

scenes.label: *father's_room
texts: But as I walked, I stopped in front of my dad's room.
It hadn't been touched since the day my dad died.
It wasn't like I wanted to keep the memories alive, or 'cause I thought he might actually come back...
I just didn't want to be reminded of him.
I was his son, but he'd never really paid much attention to me.
He'd spent all his free time after work sitting in his room, just...working on something. That's how he spent his days off too.
He always seemed so distant, working away with his back to me. It's his back that comes to mind when I remember those days...
He never once turned to look at me.
Man. Why am I getting sentimental?
This was the first time I'd thought about my dad in a while, and I was just fine with that.

texts: I clicked my tongue and went to close the door...

texts: The next thing I knew, I was lying on the floor.
Momo was right in front of me, looking at my face with a worried expression.
I felt like everything I'd ever experienced suddenly rushed through my head and flashed before my eyes.
Yeah, she was right about that.
I was overcome with heavy fatigue, and my heart was beating extremely fast.
I didn't know what had happened, so I just sat there for a while.
